website_summaries.verdict: Small enough to sit on a desk or dresser, but large enough to hold a few fish, this kit makes it easy to start keeping pet fish.
pros: You'll get a 5-gallon etched-glass tank with aluminum trim, tank hood with LED lighting system, and BioMax bio ring filter system
You'll need to add decorations, gravel, water conditioner, and fish care items, along with a few small fish
cons: No heater is included, so unless you plan on keeping goldfish or Bettas in the tank, you'll need to add one

website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy, classic tank sized right for most small fish, but its filter system will need a bit of retrofitting to reduce currents and suction.
pros: Durable tank with plenty of room for a variety of small fish
Strong filter system keeps the water clean yet runs quietly
cons: Betta and other small fish owners may need to add a pre-filter sponge to the filter in order to reduce its suction and current
No notch for heater or air pump cord available

customer_reviews.title: This tank has killed several of my fish.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tank since August of 2014. I loved the look, but over time the filter system has killed several fish. It's setup where smaller fish like tetras and guppies can get sucked into it. They are too big to go all the way into the system, but they get stuck and if you aren't right there when it happens then they can't get free and die. I love how sleek the aquarium is, but it's time for a better system.
customer_reviews.author: TOTOinKCMO

customer_reviews.title: Very nice aquarium.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice aquarium that sits on my desk. I originally got it for my Betta it's fins were damaged by the water return at the top. This despite putting a filter sponge on the output vent to slow the water down. Had to move him out. Now I have just a few tropical fish and red shrimp. I enjoy watching them while I am working. Probably spend more time watching this tank that any other I have. Update 2/2/2017: Bumped this up to 5 stars. I really like this aquarium. Now that it is fully cycled maintenance is once every 7 to 9 days. Plants are doing very well and fish/shrimp are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amz Cust

customer_reviews.title: Bad for betta
customer_reviews.text: This tank is not ideal for bettas as the filter, although adjustable, is too strong. Both the intake and pump push and pull it around. I would definitely recommend getting a tank and filter separate instead of an all-in-one. EDIT: After 1 year of use, I've downgraded from a 2 star to a 1 star because the pump has stopped working. I greatly regret getting this aquarium. I must now decide if I'll start from scratch or if I'll cut out the internal filter and add in a new filter. This is an awful situation as there is a living creature living in this aquarium that is now without filtration.
customer_reviews.author: aph

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice aquarium
customer_reviews.text: Though the price is high for a small aquarium, I felt that because of the newer technology it has, in the long run it will cost me less to maintain. There are no disposable filters. According to the experts, even with goldfish, one only needs to clean the sponge and wash off the white "rocks" and charcoal occasionally. The only real problem I have is feeding my fish. I need to move the top aside to do this because the light bar covers the opening in the top of the aquarium. The shape of the tank is very different from other 5 gallon aquariums, so you may need to find a stand to fit the dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: cindy l.

customer_reviews.title: Great Nano Tank
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these, they're real gems, and new versions keep coming out with improved lighting. The all-in-one system is the way to go for a nano tank. I have 7 nano aquaria in total. In-Tank makes a custom media rack that pairs with this unit perfectly for $50. Orbit Marine makes a nice 18 inch LED system for $80 that fits perfectly onto this lid. The stock lighting in this is junk. Plan on upgrading if you buy this. It comes with a sponge filter, works fine if you want a planted tank. Definitely get the media rack if you want to make this into a marine setting.
customer_reviews.author: Casey L.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tank! I had to call and get a second one sent, as the original came packaged in a much larger box (with the manufacturer's box inside it) with some crumpled brown paper beside it. It was literally glass dust and shards when it arrived. The second one arrived in perfect condition, but that must have been dumb luck - it was packed exactly like the first. I've had the whole one up and running at my office for over 6 months and it is amazing! I've got shrimp, snails and love plants and it is beautiful, silent and very easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: Love how it looks, but...
customer_reviews.text: Mechanical filtration is really lacking to me. I ended up getting a second internal filter to add more flow and add some surface disruption, as I did have to plug up the outflow to make it a more friendly environment for my betta. I have a wild-type and he's a strong swimmer. Still gets pushed around without the sponge stuck on, so the sponge is staying. The light is pretty decent, I haven't had any problem growing plants. It makes a nice shrimp or betta tank. And the compact size makes easy to fit just about anywhere. Just needs some minor adjustments if you're keeping a fish in it.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Constant cleaning of the filter
customer_reviews.text: I have to clean the filter every week. I I only have 1 male Beta fish and 1 Pleco. The tank itself is pretty, however the thing that drew me to buy this tank was easy maintenance, but I'm constantly having to change the water and clean the filter. Any suggestions ? (I only have about 3 very small plants in my tank. I have 2 'crystal balls' that stay covered with algae so I'm constantly cleaning them with a rubber paint sponge, and one Beta log, not a floating one & that's where the Pleco stays)
customer_reviews.author: becky woodell

customer_reviews.title: Great tank
customer_reviews.text: All you really need is a heater, depending on the type of fish you plan to keep. I planned to house a betta fish on this tank. I noticed that even in the lowest setting, the flow is a bit strong. However, I ordered a fluval pre filter sponge that fits perfectly on the output nozzle of the filter and lowers the flow tremendously without completelyblocking the flow. Works great ! I am very with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and very pretty to look up but ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and very pretty to look up but the filtration is not so good. Water is supposed to flow thru the little grate, go thru the media while the pump pulls it up thru the tube and out the nozzle at the top. I never see any water flowing thru the grate. There is a small slit at the bottom where the water gets pulled in but not thru the filter media so much from that point. There is always a film over the top of the water...always! I wouldn't buy this again
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered Two. Both Arrived Broken...
customer_reviews.text: Probably would have loved the tank if I received it in one piece. First one came with the base broken in pieces so I ordered a replacement. The replacement arrived with two of the glass wall smashed in...What's up with that???
customer_reviews.author: P. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Great tank for any level of enthusist
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tank. The only thing it was lacking is a heater. It has a great bio filter setup which is housed at one end with the pump behind a panel which hides it all from view. We bought a compact heater which we slid down in the same cavity as the pump so it's hidden as well. Comes with an LED light bar that illuminates the tank nicely with day and night modes.
customer_reviews.author: revelstone77

customer_reviews.title: 1 phenomenal little tank
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this aquarium. It was easy to put together and it is beautiful. My betta absolutely loves it. I did not experience any trouble with the filter being too powerful as some people have mentioned and their reviews. I just put the filter on the lowest setting and it barely moves the water at all. Here is a picture.I love the fact that it has two light settings and all you do is touch the lamp and the light changes.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Try the lights system first
customer_reviews.text: What attracted me the most of this tank was the 37 LED lighting system with remote control. At arrival I set it up right away filled the tank, decorated beautifully, conditioned the water and surprised, surprised the light did not work. I kept it because after going through the trouble of setting it up I just didn't have the energy to pack everything back. for that reason I give it one star. If you choose to buy it try the lights first.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Cruz

customer_reviews.title: I would have given it a higher rating...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's a nice aquarium. Unfortunately, the lid was cracked right out of the box. The box and packaging, including the shipping box were all in perfect condition. Which means it was already broken when boxed up... If I receive a replacement lid, I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R. from NC

customer_reviews.title: Great tank!
customer_reviews.text: Great tank! It's glass and looks really nice. I put my betta fish in it and he couldn't be happier. The filter is really good and you can't hear it. In fact, I sometimes have to put remove the cover and check that it's actually on. If you're using it for a betta don't cut holes in the tubing or anything. Just get a foam cover (you can see it in my pic) and it gets rid of any current. The only thing that could be better is if it came with a heater built in. I'd pay more to have a nice heater built into the filter area.
customer_reviews.author: O_o

customer_reviews.title: Fish killer!
customer_reviews.text: We have lost two beta fish and four aquatic African draws frogs due to being literally ripped apart and sucked into the quarter inch filter inlet. My son doesn't even want to have a fish ever again after this. Thanks for nothing. 😡
customer_reviews.author: Sb5000

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tank for almost two years and my betta Fancypants and I love it. I replaced the carbon in the filter with some more biological media and put a sponge over the outflow to weaken the flow as it was too strong for FP even on the lowest setting. This tank looks great and works great. The filter keeps everything clean and the light is sufficient to grow plants.
customer_reviews.author: KurtzFam

customer_reviews.title: Cool tank, but light is bright and center plastic lid has wide opening that would have been better closed up.
customer_reviews.text: It is everything as you see it----very unique with it's longer, slimmer look as compared to other square fish tanks. The light on top is quite bright---it is a bit glaring and so I leave it off pretty much. The flimsy, plastic lid on top has a rather wide opening and depending on your fish, you may want to find some creative way to close it---I have two cats ready to kill, kill, kill any living thing in this tank so I have to close it up for now with plastic and tape (I will need to find another way to close it for long term). Plus, some fish might actually jump out I imagine. Otherwise---very cool looking tank.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Wish i would have bought this tank first!
customer_reviews.text: I wish i would have bought this tank first for my betta fish! It is a fantastic tank and very easy set up. I did read in another review that the current from the filter output could still be a bit strong for the betta and they recommended purchasing the Fluval EDGE Pre-Filter Sponge at the same time. It was only an extra 5$ so i figured worst came to worst, I wouldn't use it but we I am glad we did! It disperses the water so well that I questioned if the water was even coming out - i placed a piece of food to see if there was a current - it works great! Overall, a great tank!!
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Great Planted Betta and Shrimp Tank
customer_reviews.text: I love this tank. This is my first planted tank and shrimp tank. The light is solid and my plants have all grown extremely well. For my plants I use a fertilizer from Aquarium Coop twice a week and I use Seachem Excel every other day. In my tank I have a betta, a green cory catfish, 2 red racer nerite snails, 2 king koopa snails, 2 fire red shrimp, 1 blue velvet shrimp and 6 babies, and 2 Amano shrimp. I recommend that you use a fluval edge prefilter sponge over the filter output nozzle to dampen the flow for a betta. Overall an excellent little tank that is easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: By far the best nano-tank if a well setup and dimensionally correct 5g ...
customer_reviews.text: By far the best nano-tank if a well setup and dimensionally correct 5g countertop aquarium is what you are looking for. The quality is spot on if not a little better than expected for the price. Just remember this is not your "grandfather's inch-thick-glass 500 pounds dry" tank. My first order arrived shattered in the box to my disappointment but I bucked up and ordered another... Disappointment fell away as soon as water started pumping through it. I highly recommend. Cheers and good luck to all Aquarist.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cracked corners
customer_reviews.text: Excited to set up my tank today the noticed two cracked corners. Still works tho!
customer_reviews.author: Mister M

customer_reviews.title: Great tank, poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: Novice here. I bought this tank for my betta fish. It's a nice looking tank. Easy to clean. Good size. My only complaint is the set-up instructions. They're basically black and white pictures that leave out a lot of info. I had to watch a youtube video to make sure I was setting up the filter correctly. I'm new to this, so the idea of putting wires underwater without an instruction telling me to do so freaked me out. In the end, it's a great tank.
customer_reviews.author: Anita J. Cronk

customer_reviews.title: nice starter size
customer_reviews.text: nice starter size, easy to set up. HEADS UP... Fluval edge 25w heater WILL NOT HEAT this aquarium to the 78 deg. it promises. Had it for 2 months and highest temperature I can get is 74 deg. regardless of room temp.
customer_reviews.author: barbara williams

customer_reviews.title: Gilligan's happy
customer_reviews.text: I love it, so does my betta. It was slightly wider than advertised, but still works out. I bought the fluval edge filters as some suggested. They are not perfect, they're way too big. If you have a betta you'll need to reduce the flow, but try to find something smaller. My biggest problem is the cheap plastic cover, that could be designed so much better. I love the blue lights, it gives the aquarium a true black light affect. Gilligan seems to be a happy camper. :-) he built a bubble nest last night.
customer_reviews.author: MarMed

customer_reviews.title: Love the tank but one of the ends of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the tank but one of the ends of the lid came broken. It was well packed and I did not see any pieces of plastic anywhere in the box so I really don't know what happened. Although I can still put the lid on the tank, I am disappointed it came broken. Also the screw that holds the light in place doesn't do the job. That is no big deal, I can get another stronger screw that will work better. However the lid really bothers me and I wish I could get the lid replaced. Unfortunately, I noticed it was broken after I had set up the tank (filter, decor)
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, difficult to manage sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Managing things like CO2 or algae cleaning is a big pain with this tank, because the lid has no ports for tubes. So essentially, I have to undo my entire CO2 setup every time I want to access the tank. It's a big oversight that could be fixed easily - just add some space on the edge of the lid to thread tubes through!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Tank For Aquascaping
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this purchase. I wanted to get into aquascaping without breaking the bank, and this fit the bill very well. I tested the tank for leaks after receiving it and found none. The LED light has two features- one for daytime and another for nighttime lighting. The filter/pump works silently, but I do agree with the other reviewers that the outward flow is a bit strong for betta fish. A cheap and easy fix would be to stick an exit filter sponge over the spout to decrease the flow intensity. The compartment for the filter can also house a water heater if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Berfie

customer_reviews.title: Light went out already?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this tank kit back in Oct of 2017 and as of June 2018 the light has gone out completely. It started with a few flickers here and there and then progressed to no more. I think the tank is a great buy but the light it not. Makes me wonder, what else is going to go wrong with it and its barely 8 months old. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my desktop
customer_reviews.text: My class pet loves it and my students enjoy the relaxing feeling of watching my fish swimming. Read the reviews and get the heater they recommend. No clutter at all. I LOVE it and have ordered my daughter one for her classroom,too.
customer_reviews.author: Awakened

customer_reviews.title: Great tank
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast, in one piece. The filter system is silent and the pump has an adjustable flow switch. Flow is too strong for my betta even on lowest setting but was easily remedied with a. The lid cover is plastic with an opening in the center. If the lid were glass and solid and if there were a dimmer light setting it would be much better. There isn't a space for the heater chord, I threaded it through the opening in the lid. Beautiful aquarium, very sleek and modern.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Damaged but good
customer_reviews.text: It came broken. The lid was cracked and so was the back corner plastic. Looks super sharp and sleek. Love that the filtration is hidden.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Santos

customer_reviews.title: I love this tank
customer_reviews.text: I love this tank, great for my Betta. I did have to use the Fluval pre filtersponge to baffle the flow of the output since it was pretty strong. I'm definitely buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Great!
customer_reviews.text: Very good tank. The filter setup is perfect. The partially open lid is great for easy feeding while keeping the critters inside. Great instructions as well. I'd highly recommend it to anyone interested in aquariums. Tip- If you want the blue lights on with the white lights, you can place a ceramic magnet near the front and it will activate the blues and whites at the same time. Hopefully I'm about to upload a picture of that placement.
customer_reviews.author: Otto

customer_reviews.title: Setup and it leaks upset :(
customer_reviews.text: It’s freaking leaking just got it set it up and it leaks appears to have a little slight crack right by the silicon I’ve been having a lot of trouble with stuff from amazon lately shipments being wrong all together stuff broke or cracked if it the weather is anyone else been having more issues then normal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tank. And easy to make betta friendly
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing tank. I have a betta fish and I wanted to give him a larger tank, but I did t want to see all the filtration and heating. This tank has nice little area to house all that. The flow is really strong, but bettas are also kinda wimpy swimmers. I pop some pin holes in the pump tube and get a filter sponge. I also but some netting over the intake because my betta likes to sleep there.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Young

customer_reviews.title: Very substandard filtering
customer_reviews.text: The plastic top came broken and the plastic bad is barely strong enough to hold the tank. After having the tank a few month I have found the filter system to be substandard. Small to medium partial just pass thru the sponge. The company needs to improve filtration.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great little aquarium
customer_reviews.text: Love the aquarium. I was looking for something narrow. It holds 3or 4 fish with success. My one and only complaint is that the top piece arrived with 2 of the corners broken. I glued one back on and am doing without the other. It wasn’t worth the trouble to return.
customer_reviews.author: Ororo M

customer_reviews.title: Love this tank
customer_reviews.text: Love this tank! I only wish I knew how hard it was to maintain a nano tank :P Prepare for algae. I also wish they would disclose more information about the light that comes with this tank
customer_reviews.author: Hizzy

customer_reviews.title: Just a few tweaks I’ve made on my part and this is now a great tank
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it for almost a year now and I Love my tank, looks and preforms great! the only problem I have is there is not a big enough space in the filter section to place a heater without aggravation of keeping the hater from touching the filter tube and cord. it’s a pain in the butt. I defiantly will buy another fluvall tank and bigger:) The media sponge could use another cut out for a 3rd section of filter media to be added.. Over all a A-
customer_reviews.author: Quality is what I’m looking for..

customer_reviews.title: Replacing the Pump Already
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research to give my betta the best home, and was really pleased with how well this worked out. Unfortunately, in less than two months, the pump has stopped working and am now having to buy a replacement. Pretty disappointed with the quality now.
customer_reviews.author: Light

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, but ineffective.
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. The aesthetic value of this tank is unmatched, along with the silent filter; however, the water pump/filter system does not seem to filter much of anything. A white film develops on the top of the water, and if you angle the pump towards the top it simply swirls around the film. Beautiful tank, but not an effective filter system. I saw one other review complaining of the same thing. Seriously, buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda.b.rand

customer_reviews.title: leaks
customer_reviews.text: Bought in Feb 2019, started leaking in October 2019. Had to toss water everywhere. Also 2 motors have died in short time.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Water has been tested and it is fine so no explanation as to why it clouds
customer_reviews.text: I am really unhappy with this tank and am past the return date unfortunately. The water clouds within days of cleaning no matter what I do or add. Water has been tested and it is fine so no explanation as to why it clouds. Added an airstone to help with moving the water.. helped delay the cloudiness but still cloudy. I clean this tank .. complete water change .. once a week. Way too much for a 5 gallon tank and one betta. :/
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner or betta tank.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent beginner tank or betta tank. The filter is a little weaker than I would like. However it is the perfect filter for a betta or any other fish that likes a slower current.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas C Jones

customer_reviews.title: Broken. Cheap Quality
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked and the top is broken along with the base. Seems like this is a reoccurring issue based on other reviews. Sold by Amazon and not another party. According to Amazon they cannot replace it for at least another five weeks. Since I can’t wait five weeks, I decided to keep it with a refund of $15 on a product that cost over $100. That’s the best they could do. Expected better quality from a product at this price and better service from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, but...
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely beautiful tank that would be well designed for many types of fish. The pump is quiet and seems efficient. Like the other reviewers have said, the pump is too strong for my crown tail betta, and despite all of the suggested modifications to decrease flow and limit turbulence, I am not able to turn the pump on because he keeps getting his fins sucked into the filter. He is not a good swimmer. Am wondering what to do at this point..I would appreciate any suggestions from others. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Columbus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Aquarium
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasently surprised to open the box of this aquaruim and find it so beautifully made. Its was easy assembly just open the 1 small pouches of media insert the sponge , put the pump on the other slot and hook up the spout , add sand, rocks, plants, (made a little river bed out of pebbles) fill with water and plug in. The light just slides into it's slot ... I can't even hear the pump it's so quiet. I love this aquarium for my Betta fish. Perfect. Thanks Fluval for making the "Spec V Aquarium 5 gallon so easy and beautiful. Very happy customer, I just bought my sister one and had it shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Very Sleek, Perfect For Betta Fish !
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tank ! Wasn’t too hard to put together, runs smoothly. Love the lighting daytime and nighttime. I do wish it came with a heater ( I bought the Hydor 25w and fits perfectly in pump chamber). The pump isn’t loud, it has a steady water flow-not sure if it’s too much for Betta fish, but there are ways to slow the flow down. Can’t wait to add my first Betta fish to it! I would definitely buy another one if I were to get another Betta.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Curry

customer_reviews.title: Elegant and Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and I love them. The filter is so quiet. The light is bright and my plants are growing like weeds. Its very easy to clean and the filter does a great job of keeping the water clear. The look is very elegant. This is my favorite aquarium
customer_reviews.author: M Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This aquarium is a unique for a fish thank.
customer_reviews.text: This aquarium is a unique for a fish tank. The betta happily swim back and forth. The lighting is beautiful and modern. It makes the aquarium so relaxing just to look at it.
customer_reviews.author: Maricruz Navidad

customer_reviews.title: Survived shipping
customer_reviews.text: The tank arrived intact without any noticeable damage. It looks as described. I can't wait until I am able to move my Betta over from his quarantine tank. Will update the review after testing the seals & equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Ciearas

customer_reviews.title: Broken on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Can’t really rate the aquarium as it unfortunately arrived shattered. Very disappointed as I hoped to have it in the white as local stores only have the black option.
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: Buy locally - too delicate to ship
customer_reviews.text: The box was just thrown in another box with no protection. Arrived with glass everywhere. It’s a shame. Such a nice unit otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Dan V.

customer_reviews.title: Great Betta Tank
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my Betta tank to the spec V since it was so highly reccomended. It looks really sleek and it’s nice that is comes with a light and a filter, although I recommend buying a pre filter sponge, since even on the lowest setting the flow tends to get too strong for most betta.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Rauch

customer_reviews.title: Best for Betta
customer_reviews.text: Have had several tanks in this price range , One Marineland and a different more expensive fluval tank , but this seems to look and fit the best for the betta fish we have currently , Package did arrive missing the lid but Fluval was quick to send a replacement took 3 or 4 days to get to our doorstep
customer_reviews.author: Brian O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: great new living quarters
customer_reviews.text: Have had my Fluval Spec V Aquarium Kit, 5-Gallon foe about six weeks now and absolutley love it. Very pleasing to look at, love the long dimensions. Guess I should be saying my Betta loves it. He was in a 2 gallon tank and was harder to see him. With this design he has more room to swim back and forth and more fun to watch. So we are both very happy. Have not had any problems with it at all. would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: Our Honey is happy and doing well
customer_reviews.text: Our betta, Honey, moved up to this tank and we’re all happy with it. We tried the filter sponge to help make the tank more comfortable for him, but have since removed it and made other adjustments to the filter outflow. Honey now plays in the reduced outflow and seems to be happier with more water movement. As other reviews state, he also likes to rest against the filter intake - I love catching him do this. The tank looks great in our living space too.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: good space for a single betta
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife's betta fish. He's doing quite well in it, and I'd recommend it to anyone with a betta. It's enough space for the fish and for a number of plants, and we'll be adding a snail soon, too.
customer_reviews.author: M_A

customer_reviews.title: Fast flow, easy fill, good beginner aquarium
customer_reviews.text: Good beginner tank! The flow might be too much Even on the lowest setting for some fish, can add a sponge to output or wrap with a sock and clips. Feel like it would work better for salt water mini aquariums, but fresh water will be fine!
customer_reviews.author: Mat H.

customer_reviews.title: It’s perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tank!! It’s a great shape and size for what I wanted. I keep African Dwarf Frogs and a betta fish in this tank and have had no problems with filters/water flow. It’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: MrClayShooter

customer_reviews.title: Great nano aquarium!
customer_reviews.text: I really think Fluval does a great job with these small aquariums!!! The all in one aquarium manages to seemlessky fit in the filtration so it’s not only highly effective, but very aesthetic as well. A great quality aquarium with everything it needs and a nice, clean look.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: The aquarium arrived broken. Return was easy through Amazon
customer_reviews.text: The aquarium arrived broken. Return was easy through Amazon but I opted to buy from a local store instead and matched the Amazon price. The aquarium itself is great. The filter runs quiet and the aquarium looks sleek. The light is very bright and my plants seem to be doing okay under them.
customer_reviews.author: BenGraum

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A REALLY SWEET TANK!
customer_reviews.text: FOR THE BEGINNER AND THE ADVANCED..........THIS IS A REALLY SWEET TANK!!!!!! THE LED SETUP IS GREAT FOR LOW/MID LEVEL AQUATIC PLANTS. PERFECT FOR GUPPIES, ENDLERS AND SHRIMP. LIKE SO MUCH AM GOING TO PURCHASE ANOTHER ONE !!!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Smolinski

customer_reviews.title: Its a nice looking aquarium
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the black one for my office. Its a nice looking aquarium. The filter is quiet, which was a concern, again I am in an office. My intention with this was to go freshwater planted with a black sand substrate. The filter seems plenty strong enough, but the light is pretty weak. I would suggest only using very sturdy low light plants, or plan on finding an alternative solution for the light source. There is no way this light is even half the strength it needs to be for saltwater.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cote

customer_reviews.title: Dirty? And missing a lot/broken pin on lid.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing aside from the fact that I spent a lot of money and the tank arrived without any of my filtration stuff. I’m missing 5,6, and 7 from the list above. I contacted customer support and zero response yet; will change stars depending upon how they handle this.
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: Cheap light fixture but otherwise it's not bad.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay, but the light does not always work. We usually have to unplug it to turn it off because the switch mechanism was broken out of the box. It would also be nice if there were notches on the back side of the lid so you could feed tubing through. I do like the profile: it's not as deep as other tanks and it works well on our countertop.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Small and baby fish killer
customer_reviews.text: It is a very nice set, but it kills fish. The small hole for the filter and the pump sucks too much water for the filter even with the low setting. The small ones get sucked all the way into the filter and died. Or, they get stuck in the hole and die. I even covered with messy, but it did not help.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: I love this tank
customer_reviews.text: I like that this tank comes with a filter system and lighting. 5 gallons, to me, is a good size tank for a betta. I love the look of the tank. You can hide the power cords behind the tank. The filter isn’t loud; I have the tank in my room and can sleep fine with the filter running. I would highly recommend this tank.
customer_reviews.author: Monglang

customer_reviews.title: Not great if using a heater
customer_reviews.text: The lid isn't conducive to using other electronics like a heater. No way to weave the wire through. Also, the filter was not compatible with our fish. He hates it and bites his tail when it is on.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great aquarium and have had it running for about a week. This is the first aquarium we have owned, and it was easy to set up and seems to run well. We have a betta and 3 neon tetras in the tank and they are all getting along really well and seem very comfortable in their new home. The filter is fine on the middle or low setting for our betta. He swims all over and gets blown around sometimes by the filter, but nothing he can't handle. Love this aquarium!
customer_reviews.author: CatM

customer_reviews.title: Difficult tank
customer_reviews.text: This fish tank grows algae. I believe it's the new LED light that comes with the new tank. My last fluval tank did not have algae growth. I have to clean it every other day.
customer_reviews.author: moneypenny

customer_reviews.title: Love this aquarium
customer_reviews.text: Love this aquarium. It's just the right size without being too big. We have about 5-8 small guppies - and it's perfect for them. We put a plant in front of the water outlet b/c the stream was a little strong for the small fish. Other than that it seems perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Breakfast

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I love this aquarium. It sleek design is unmatchable. I did receive one damaged, but Im sure that was a shipping problem Amazon quickly replaced it though and the replacement came unharmed. Other then that never had issues
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Wrong dimensions provided on the listing
customer_reviews.text: The listing states the total height of the unit is 10.6". This is WRONG and caused it to not fit in the space that I wanted to use it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rende

customer_reviews.title: The has been a really great purchase for my Betta
customer_reviews.text: The has been a really great purchase for my Betta. The size is perfect for a few fish and it was easy to find a place to put it. The light that came with it broke almost immediately so that could be an issue. I had purchased the Fennex Planted+ though so thankfully I didn't need it. The stock light is really dim so if possible you may want to consider an upgrade to a better light, even if it's not planted.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: LED was dead in a week. It was my first aquarium, now need to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer_SS

customer_reviews.title: Filter isn't as good as expected.
customer_reviews.text: As a betta tank I'm not happy with the filter. Doesn't seem to collect any debris. Wish the intake was lower
customer_reviews.author: Candice Boettcher

customer_reviews.title: A better tank for a Betta
customer_reviews.text: A much better tank for our betta fish, we put a sunken ship inside and the fish was much more happy than the old 2 gallon tank.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Property Solutions

customer_reviews.title: GREAT seller!
customer_reviews.text: I will be using Josh's Frogs for all my aquarium purchases! The customer service it over the top, best ever! Shelbs, is the best! Quick reply and got the job done! Thanks, you just made a customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Just about perfect
customer_reviews.text: I waited a month before writing the review just in case the tank sprung a leak. It is pricey for a 5 gallon tank, but it does everything well. It's easy to set up, silent and just beautiful. We got about a dozen guppies and they are healthy looking. Everything is quality built and flawless. Even the lighting is perfect. It may not be bright, but it is stunning in a dark room. Don't hesitate to buy this winner.
customer_reviews.author: huntinghawk

customer_reviews.title: Very easy setup. I read alot of reviews before purchasing ...
customer_reviews.text: Moved 2 male bettas from 1.6 gallon to their own 5 gallon tank. Very easy setup. I read alot of reviews before purchasing the Hydor 50 watt submersiible glass heater and had no problem fitting them snugly along the water pump. I cycled both tanks in one day using Tetra Safe Start Plus after following instructions from Tetra customer service. Zeus and Sammy love their new homes. The reason for 4 stars is the semi open top cover, water evaporates faster and dust particles accummulate requiring maintenance every couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: J Bino

customer_reviews.title: Love this tank
customer_reviews.text: Love this tank. But I only give it 3 stars because the flow of water is waaaayyyyy to strong for bettas. I obstruct the flow of water with a faux plant so my little guy doesn't go flying across the tank. Other than that just the right size, clean design and quiet filter. Only the best for my Freddy!
customer_reviews.author: Carmela Palumbo

customer_reviews.title: Bought this tank as a Christmas gift for my girlfriend ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tank as a Christmas gift for my girlfriend and she loves it. The return pump is weak in my opinion but, I suspect it will get the job done for her but, you might consider something stronger if you are going to stock this with stuff. The evaporation rate on this was much higher than I expected, plan on adding water almost daily - I suggest keeping a container of distilled water handy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hinz

customer_reviews.title: Nice aquarium
customer_reviews.text: I like this aquarium and how all the equipment is hidden. It doesn’t come with a heater but has a space for one. Nice for a beginner or small space.
customer_reviews.author: Kay S

customer_reviews.title: Beginner friendly
customer_reviews.text: It’s very sleek looking and pretty. It’s a little awkward to clean and get the filtration system modified but you can definitely make it work and look nice. The filter is a little strong for this size aquarium and will create a strong current in the water that needs to be modified.
customer_reviews.author: Myles

customer_reviews.title: Small crack
customer_reviews.text: Well, the tank design and everything about the initial setup was really nice, but I found a small crack on the upper rim *sob*. I'm returning this one for another and will update once I set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Bloopmnstr

customer_reviews.title: Fluval Spec V
customer_reviews.text: The Spec V is an attractive small light weight aquarium with a modern looking light fixture. The pump is extremely quiet, but is squeezed into a very narrow chamber. Some say they fit the heater in with the pump, mine was too long to do that so I may look for a shorter heater and give it a try. I've only had it running for one week and I've not added fish yet, but thus far I'm enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee D

customer_reviews.title: You have to clean filter media every 4 weeks or looses pressure.
customer_reviews.text: It's very nice ,the filter is Just ok. I have to clean out filter and media every 4 weeks
customer_reviews.author: denise may

customer_reviews.title: Great little aquarium
customer_reviews.text: Great little aquarium! The light really illuminates the while tank, and the filter is powerful and so quiet I thought it wasn't on the first time I plugged it in. The back has enough space for a small tank heater and my betta seems to love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Looks great though on my desk
customer_reviews.text: Wish there was a bit lower setting on the pump or a baffled tip, that current is fast even on lowest setting. Looks great though on my desk, perfect size and good aesthetics.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Larson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size to sit on our kitchen cabinet counters
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 tanks for our Giant Betta and Half Moon Betta. Perfect size to sit on our kitchen cabinet counters. Easy to set up and stays very clean. Did have to put some of the "sponge filter material" into the water inlet, too much turbelance for the Bettas and for the Half Moon I put an old net over the upper outlet. Also positioned a plant right in front of the lower little slit so the Betta didn't get sucked into it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Felicetta

customer_reviews.title: Great size for beta
customer_reviews.text: Took the advice of some other reviews. This is perfect for my beta fish. The 3 gallon cube was really inadequate. This is perfect. Also large enough for a small floating log.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: Tank seems poorly built but the filter pump is way too strong. There are Youtube videos on how to make it functional but for the price it should be better out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son's 4th birthday. Super quiet pump, easy to clean, sleek looking. The light is powerful enough for live plants.
customer_reviews.author: Stormie

customer_reviews.title: Loved && Highly Recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: This Fluval Spec V Aquarium Kit is GREAT for beginners who love fish. This tank is made best for a Betta fish to keep. I recommend to place a Fluval Pre-Filter on the intake pump for the Betta fish. Even though the flow is low, it is still too strong for sensitive Betta fish. The filter sponge is very easy to maintain (just clean in old tank water-keeping the good bacteria). Easily decorate to desire (favorite part), add small heater inside by intake pump, and add aquarium fish. Highly recommended and will purchase Fluval Aquarium tanks in the future!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Best mini tank available.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little tank. It's essentially a ten gallon cut in half depth wise, meaning there us a pretty large viewing window. Light is bright enough for plants and the filter is completely quiet. Best 'mini' aquarium out there.
customer_reviews.author: Bmore corgis

customer_reviews.title: I like it but it has to be clean every 2- ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it but it has to be clean every 2- or 3 weeks I think the filter is not good enough or strong enough but it looks real nice when its set up
customer_reviews.author: Joe.S

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I am reviewing on the day of delivery and setup, so I don’t know about long term function. It did arrive 2 days early, and was packaged well! It was a little tedious fitting the heater in the hidden compartment, but it does fit and everything is functioning correctly! It is stunning, and exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.author: Hailey

product_meta.title: Fluval Spec V Aquarium Kit, 5-Gallon
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Product Packaging:Standard Packaging

Fluval SPEC is a contemporary looking aquarium designed for small areas such as desktops and countertops. This 5-gallon etched glass aquarium with aluminum trim combines style and functionality in one small package. Though small in stature, Fluval SPEC is big on features. It comes with a sleekly designed overhanging LED lighting system, consisting of 37 powerful LED lamps, that arches above the aquarium to provide brilliant illumination for plants and décor. The aquarium includes a powerful circulation pump with adjustable output nozzle and a large 3-stage filtration system that provides more than enough filtration for ultra clean and clear water. It also comes with all the necessary filter media for effective and thorough mechanical, chemical and biological filtration: a porous foam block with convenient handle traps large particles and debris, activated carbon adsorbs unwanted odors, discolorations and impurities and BioMax insert provides optimal colonization of beneficial bacteria and enhances the nitrification of fish wastes. The pump and filtration system are conveniently located in a separate chamber at one end of the aquarium to simplify maintenance. To ensure the well-being of aquarium inhabitants, it is essential to maintain your aquarium. At the very minimum, remove 20% of the water once a week and replace with tap water that is of similar temperature to your tank and treated with the correct dose of Nutrafin Aqua Plus. Regular replacement of Fluval filter media is essential to ensure optimum performance. The filter media should be changed alternately in order to maintain continuous biological activity. To enhance bacterial action, pour a dose of Nutrafin Cycle onto your filter inserts each time you change the media.
feature_bullets: 5-gallon etched glass aquarium with aluminum trim
High-output 7000K LED with all-aluminum, waterproof casing for enhanced plant growth and fish colors
Powerful 3-stage filtration for superior water quality and stylish honeycomb wrap to conceal rear filtration compartment
Includes glass aquarium with cover; LED lighting system; safe, low-voltage transformer; circulation pump with output nozzle; foam filter block with handle; activated carbon insert; and BioMax insert

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
